column3: Go to the admin applications search page at /admin/admin_site_search
Restrict search journals to smaller number (eg. choose only "Subject" -> "Technology" and "Country"-> "Spain")
From the "Journals vs. Articles" assets on the left choose Journals

column4: Correct restricted search results appear, note the summary number of journals found for future reference

column3: From Bulk Edit Records "Select action..." pull down choose "Journal: edit metadata ..."

column4: Form unfold below the pull down that includes fields: "Publisher", "Platform, Host or Aggregator", "Country", "Owner", "Contact Name", "Contact's email address", "Qualifies for Seal"

column3: Input value for one or many of the fields

column4: Pop up appears: "This operation will affect #nr journals" (#nr is number of journals, the same as number of journals in search result from 2.3.1)
Message banner appears on the top of the page that includes:
Numer of journals queued for edit
Link to the background job interface

column3: Click on the link provided to see the background job that was created

column4: The set_in_doaj background job is created
set_in_doaj__journal_ids parameter contains correct number of journals' ids and set_in_doaj__in_doaj -- true parameter is set

column3: Click dismiss on the message banner
